content:
re :. I have removed the account from Thunderbird, as well as all the related contacts,

Oauth request access can occur for mail account email and gmail contact address book and also gmail calendars.

You say you have completely removed the gmail mail account. So it's no longer in Thunderbird. You mention removing all related contacts - however contacts are just email addresses which can be move to any address book.....can I assume you have also removed all gmail address books ?

Have you removed all gmail calendars that were related to the account?

Have you removed saved passwords for that gmail account?

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll down to 'Passwords' section
  • Click on 'Saved Passwords'

If you see any lines that mention gmail and the email address of 'removed' gmail account, then select the relevant lines(s) and click on 'Remove'. Click on 'Close'

Exit/Close Thunderbird and wait a few moments for background processes to complete and then start Thunderbird.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Didn't work...connection timed out and didn't send. Put it back to Port 465 and SS/TLS and wonder of wonders, it sent. This is very confusing. Sometimes it will send and sometimes not.
creator: tommymeisel

content:
I would suggest trying normal password not oauth. While it does appear in the database for comcast I have a strong suspicion that is is only available for comcast corporate email accounts not customer accounts and it has somehow ended up in the general database for all.

Historically connections were encrypted using SSL. This protocol was fundamentally superseded some 10 years ago by TLS which performs exactly the same function in end to end encrypted connections. Thunderbird still uses the terminology SSL/TLS although the SSL part of the encryption was turned of years ago. Selecting SSL/TLS in Thunderbird is selecting TLS

Outgoing Mail Server Name: smtp.comcast.net Port Number: 587 (SMTP) If Needed: 465 (SMTPS)

These are both provided on the Comcast website in that form, however the accepted standard is to use SMTPS when using encrypted connections i.e. SSL/TLS. So choose port 465.

Encryption: TLS (use SSL if TLS isn't shown.) See https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/email-client-programs-with-xfinity-email

This discussion from 2019 indicated Xfinity made a change some 6 years ago requiring encrypted connections, so my guess is the oAuth authentication method is not working for you, not the other settings. But check them just to be sure. https://www.xfinity.com/support/articles/update-your-xfinity-email-settings
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hello there

In the time that you send me that crash report. Try to start up in troubleshooting mode. Go for that sending these same mails and these same attachments to a test e-mail address that is added on the pc to test if that issue is still there when that pc is in trouble shoot mode. It can be useful to start with safe modus for win or Mac then after that run Thunderbird into that troubleshoot mode. That one installed add on can be turned off in the meanwhile. Look for the antivirus software on that pc , and scan moments that are running for thunderbird at the same time or not with the Thunderbird software , turn these scans temporarily to off.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

Problem 2: In my Thunderbird e-mail I do have three e-mails that show, one for normal, one for junk, and the old one. The old one has a yellow star by it

I do not understand allof what you say, but the fact there is a yellow star says the address is in your address book. Whilst ever the email address is on your address book it will be offered for autofill So remove the address book entry to that email address. It will not affect the emails existence. So click the star and select delete from the options that appear instead of edit.

content:
If you sent from the MyName account but the recipient replied to the Info account, it means the MyName account was sending through the smtp with Info's User Name, and gmail automatically made your message appear to be sent from Info.

You must have separate smtp servers for each account, with the same settings except for the User Name, and set each account to send through the matchong smtp:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1350593
creator: sfhowes
